skill.name: db-handler
skill.description: Manage database schemas, Drizzle ORM, migrations, and data modeling. Use when creating tables, modifying columns, or planning database changes.
skill.summary: Manage database schemas, Drizzle ORM, migrations, and data modeling. Use when creating tables, modif...
skill.author: AayushBaniya2006

security_audit.summary: Static analysis detected 46 patterns but most are false positives. The Ruby backtick patterns are in markdown code examples showing PostgreSQL syntax, not executable code. The weak cryptography findings are in skill-report.json metadata, not actual code. No malicious intent or dangerous operations found in the skill implementation.

low_findings.title: Documentation Code Examples
low_findings.description: Skill documentation contains code examples that triggered pattern matching false positives
low_findings.recommendation: No action needed - these are legitimate documentation examples

content.user_title: Manage SQLite databases with natural language queries
content.value_statement: Database operations require complex SQL syntax and connection management. This skill translates natural language requests into SQLite operations for seamless data interaction.
actual_capabilities: Execute SELECT queries to retrieve data from SQLite databases
Perform INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE operations on database tables
Create and modify database table structures and schemas
Generate SQL queries from natural language descriptions
Handle database connections and transaction management
Retrieve and format query results for analysis
limitations: Only supports SQLite database format, not MySQL or PostgreSQL
Cannot perform complex multi-database joins across different database files
Does not include built-in backup or replication features
Requires existing database file or explicit instruction to create new one

use_cases.title: Manage application user data
use_cases.description: Query and update user records, authentication data, and session information in web application databases

use_cases.title: Extract insights from local datasets
use_cases.description: Run analytical queries on SQLite data files to generate reports and identify trends without manual SQL writing

use_cases.title: Test and debug mobile app databases
use_cases.description: Inspect and modify SQLite databases used in iOS and Android applications during development and testing

prompt_templates.title: View table contents
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all records from the users table

prompt_templates.title: Filter specific records
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all orders from the last 30 days where the total amount is greater than 100 dollars

prompt_templates.title: Update multiple records
prompt_templates.prompt: Update the status to active for all users who registered in 2024 and have verified email addresses

prompt_templates.title: Create summary statistics
prompt_templates.prompt: Calculate the average order value and total revenue grouped by customer region for the current quarter

output_examples.input: Show me the top 5 customers by purchase amount
Add a new product to the inventory
output: Created new record in products table
Set status to expired for codes with end_date before today
Affected promotion campaigns: SUMMER2024, FLASH50, NEWUSER15

best_practices: Always back up your database file before performing UPDATE or DELETE operations on production data
Use specific table and column names in your requests to ensure accurate query generation
Review generated queries before execution when working with critical business data
anti_patterns: Avoid vague requests like 'fix the database' without specifying which table or issue needs attention
Do not request deletion of data without specifying clear conditions or filters
Avoid assuming table structures exist without first confirming the schema or requesting table inspection

faq.question: Can this skill work with MySQL or PostgreSQL databases?
faq.answer: No, this skill is specifically designed for SQLite databases. MySQL and PostgreSQL require different connection methods and are not supported.

faq.question: Will this skill create a database if one does not exist?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill can create a new SQLite database file if you explicitly request it. Otherwise, it expects an existing database file path.

faq.question: How does the skill handle SQL injection risks?
faq.answer: The skill generates parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection. Always review generated queries before execution for additional safety.

faq.question: Can I use this skill to migrate data between databases?
faq.answer: Basic data export and import operations are supported. Complex migrations with schema transformations may require manual query specification.

faq.question: What happens if a query fails or returns an error?
faq.answer: The skill will report the error message and suggest corrections. You can then modify your request or query based on the feedback provided.

faq.question: Can this skill optimize slow database queries?
faq.answer: The skill can suggest index creation and query structure improvements when you describe performance issues, but manual optimization may still be needed.
